content.description: A medical researcher conducted a study to investigate the effectiveness of two drugs, L and M, designed to reduce the number of seizures that people with epilepsy might have. Each person in a group of <math alttext="120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>120</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> adult volunteers who had epilepsy was randomly assigned to one of two groups. Those assigned to one group took drug L for one year, and those assigned to the other group took drug M for one year. Each participant recorded the number of seizures that occurred during the year.
content.question: To which group is it most reasonable to generalize the results of this study?

choices.label: All adults with epilepsy who take drugs to treat the disease
All adults with epilepsy who are similar to those who volunteered for the study
All adults who experience a reduction in the number of seizures

content.answer: All adults with epilepsy who are similar to those who volunteered for the study
